content:
<rule id="embedded-framework-09300" xmlns="http://windup.jboss.org/schema/jboss-ruleset">
            <when>
                <or>
                    <file filename="{*}eureka-client{*}.jar"/>
                    <project>
                        <artifact artifactId="{*}eureka-client{*}" groupId="{*}"/>
                    </project>
                </or>
            </when>
            <perform>
                <hint category-id="information" effort="0" title="Embedded framework - Eureka Client">
                    <message>
                        The application embeds the Eureka client. If you are migrating to Azure Spring Apps, the connection info of Eureka will be injected upon app start.

                        Find any explicit configurations of config server connection info:

                        If configured in **configuration files**: they will be ignored and overrided by Azure Spring Apps.

                        If configured in **command line parameters**, **Java system attribute**, **environment variable**: they need to be removed or you might experience conflicts and unexpected behavior.
                    </message>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-service-registration?pivots=programming-language-java" title="Azure Spring Apps - Enable Service Registration"/>
                    <link href="https://learn.microsoft.com/azure/spring-apps/how-to-access-data-plane-azure-ad-rbac" title="Azure Spring Apps - Access Config Server and Service Registry"/>
                    <link href="http://aka.ms/spring-cloud-to-asa?pivots=sc-standard-tier#remove-restricted-configurations" title="Restricted configurations"/>
                </hint>
                <technology-tag level="INFORMATIONAL">Eureka</technology-tag>
            </perform>
        </rule>
